result.markdown: ::: welcome ::: {.content-visible when-format="html"} # Welcome to Data Science, the SQL {.unnumbered} ::: \chapter*{} \vfill ::: {.content-visible when-format="html"} Daily class notes for Data Science, the SQL, by Jo Hardin, SDS 261 at Smith College. Built on Modern Data Science with R by Baumer, Kaplan, and Horton, 3rd ed. and R for Data Science by Wickham, Çetinkaya-Rundel, and Grolemund, 2nd ed. You are responsible for reading your texts. They are both excellent and readable, so you should use them. That said, you should also make sure you are coming to class and asking lots of questions. More information and course details can be found at the [SDS261 website](https://sds261-sql.netlify.app/). ::: ```{=html} ``` ::: {.content-visible when-format="html"} Copyright © 2023. ::: ::: {.content-hidden unless-format="pdf"} Copyright $\copyright$ 2023. ::: Version date: January 14, 2024. The notes are available under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported United States License. License details are available at the Creative Commons website:\ [**creativecommons.org**](https://creativecommons.org/). Source files for these notes can be found on GitHub at\ [https://github.com/hardin47/website/tree/gh-pages/SDS261](https://github.com/hardin47/website/tree/gh-pages/SDS261). :::
